reports.title: name="The Callisto Protocol™" appid="1544020" target_framerate="30-39 FPS" title="[wizVault] Optimize settings for 30fps"

data.game_graphics_settings:
- **LIGHTING QUALITY:** Low
- **SHADOW QUALITY:** Low
- **VOLUMETRIC LIGHTING QUALITY:** Low
- **SCREEN SPACE REFLECTIONS:** On
- **SUB-SURFACE SCATTERING:** On
- **ANTI-ALIASING METHOD:** TAA
- **RENDERER:** 85%
- **TEXTURE QUALITY:** Medium
- **ANISOTROPHIC FILTERING:** Medium
- **HDR RENDERING:** On
data.additional_notes:
Runs stable at 30 FPS, even in late game. Occasional dips may happen.
Mesh Quality: Medium

reports_summary: A player finds that The Callisto Protocol on the Steam Deck OLED generally runs in the low‑30s when capped to 30 FPS and visual detail is trimmed; with lighting, shadows and volumetrics set low and the renderer scaled to about 85% it stays largely steady even in late-game sections, though occasional dips occur. The takeaway is a clear trade-off: reduced visual fidelity buys smoother, more consistent frame pacing, and no power or battery numbers were shared so runtime impact can’t be judged from this single report.
